title: Establish Security Validation Framework
description:
Create unified security validation framework that orchestrates all security components through a comprehensive validation pipeline.

CURRENT SECURITY COMPONENTS (Existing):
- Scanner (scanner.py): CVE detection, secrets scanning, compliance checks
- Audit (audit.py): Structured logging with integrity hashing
- Access Control (access_control.py): RBAC, capabilities, risk scoring
- Compliance (compliance.py): CIS, NIST, OWASP checking
- Monitoring (monitoring.py): Real-time security event monitoring
- Policy Gate (policy_gate.py): Multi-layer validation at tool invocation

IDENTIFIED GAPS:
1. No unified validation orchestrator - components run independently
2. No validation result aggregation - no consolidated security posture
3. No real-time validation pipeline - components not coordinated
4. Missing pre/post-deployment validation gates
5. No input sanitization framework (XSS, SQL injection, command injection)
6. No output validation or state change validation
7. Limited test coverage for validation scenarios

FRAMEWORK DELIVERABLES:
1. SecurityValidationFramework class - orchestrates all validation
2. Three-phase validation pipeline: pre-execution → runtime → post-execution
3. ValidationResultAggregator - consolidates component results
4. SecurityPostureDecisionEngine - makes allow/deny decisions
5. Integration with existing Policy Gate and middleware

FILES TO CREATE:
- src/security/validation_framework.py (main framework)
- src/security/validators/ (pre/runtime/post validators)
- src/models/validation_models.py (result models)
- tests/test_validation_framework.py (comprehensive tests)

FILES TO UPDATE:
- src/security/__init__.py (export framework)
- src/services/policy_gate.py (integrate framework)
- src/auth/middleware.py (call framework before execution)
design:
Architecture: Orchestrator pattern coordinating existing components

Core Classes:
- SecurityValidationFramework: Main orchestrator
- ValidationOrchestrator: Pipeline coordinator
- ValidationResultAggregator: Result consolidation
- SecurityPostureDecisionEngine: Allow/deny decisions

Validation Phases:
1. Pre-execution: identity, authorization, input, target, operation
2. Runtime: resource limits, state changes, privilege checks
3. Post-execution: output validation, compliance, impact assessment

Integration Point: src/auth/middleware.py calls framework before tool execution
Result Caching: Add validation result caching to reduce overhead
Performance Target: <50ms validation latency for typical operations
acceptance_criteria:
1. ValidationFramework integrated into middleware
2. Three-phase pipeline operational (pre/runtime/post)
3. All existing security components orchestrated
4. Validation results aggregated with security posture scores
5. Tests covering validation pipeline, integration, failures
6. Documentation in docs/SECURITY_VALIDATION_FRAMEWORK.md
7. No regressions in existing security tests

title: Enhance container resource monitoring with per-container metrics granularity
description:
Enhance container resource monitoring with per-container metrics granularity across all monitoring systems.

CURRENT STATE:
- Docker connector HAS per-container metrics (CPU%, mem, network, disk I/O)
- Security monitoring uses HOST-LEVEL metrics only (no container awareness)
- Monitoring integrations (Prometheus, Datadog) export aggregate metrics
- Proxmox integration lacks per-container drill-down

EXISTING PER-CONTAINER METRICS (Docker Connector):
- CPU percentage
- Memory: usage, limit, percentage
- Network: RX/TX bytes
- Disk I/O: block read/write bytes
- PID tracking, timestamps

GRANULARITY GAPS:
1. SecurityMonitor doesn't call Docker stats - misses containers
2. Monitoring integrations export host-level only (no container labels)
3. No historical/trend metrics - point-in-time only
4. Proxmox integration has no per-container resource drill-down
5. Missing: container process count, network connections, disk space per container

ENHANCEMENTS NEEDED:
1. SecurityMonitor integration with Docker connector stats
2. Per-container labels in Prometheus/Datadog exports
3. Metric buffering for trend analysis (moving averages)
4. ProxmoxMetricsCollector per-container support
5. Alert rules for per-container thresholds

title: Create comprehensive performance benchmark suite with baseline metrics
description:

CURRENT STATE:

- Most are placeholders marked @pytest.mark.slow
- Framework in place: pytest + pytest-asyncio
- Instrumentation exists: time.perf_counter(), tracemalloc, psutil
- Missing: baselines, complete implementations, regression tracking

CRITICAL OPERATIONS TO BENCHMARK:

Priority 1 - Auth & Policy (runs on every tool call):
- Token verification: target <5ms p99
- Authorization check: target <2ms p99  
- Policy enforcement: target <50ms p99
- Full middleware chain: target <100ms p99

Priority 2 - Tool Execution:
- Executor creation (local/SSH/Docker)
- Tool wrapper overhead
- Complete tool invocation latency

Priority 3 - Scalability:
- Fleet scalability (10-2000 targets)
- Workflow concurrency (5-100 concurrent)
- Event processing (10-1000 events/batch)
- Concurrent users (10-200)

BASELINE METRICS TO ESTABLISH:
- Auth: token verification <5ms, scopes <2ms
- Policy Gate: validation <10ms, full enforcement <50ms
- Throughput: >200 tool ops/sec, >500 policy checks/sec
- Memory: <10MB growth over 1000 ops, <2GB peak

title: Integrate rate limiting across all tool endpoints
description:
Implement rate limiting across all 80 MCP tool endpoints to prevent denial-of-service and resource exhaustion.

CURRENT STATE: NO RATE LIMITING EXISTS
- Zero rate limiting code in production
- 80 MCP tools completely unprotected
- Middleware has auth/approval but no throttling
- Risk: DoS via repeated expensive operations (image pulls, scans, fleet discovery)

HIGH-RISK OPERATIONS NEEDING LIMITS:
CRITICAL (5 req/min):
- update_docker_container, pull_docker_image
- update_system_packages, install_package
- http_request_test (SSRF risk)

HIGH (10 req/min):
- manage_container, file_operations
- Network diagnostics (scan_ports, traceroute)
- Security scanning tools

MODERATE (20 req/min):
- Inventory operations, fleet discovery
- Read-heavy diagnostic tools

LOW (100 req/min):
- Basic read-only operations

IMPLEMENTATION:
Library: slowapi (decorator-based, Redis/memory store, async-compatible)
Alternative: aiohttp-limiter

Rate limit keys: agent identity + target/operation for granular control
Store: Memory (dev), Redis (production)
design:
Architecture: Decorator pattern on tool functions

Core Integration:
1. Add @rate_limit decorator to tools (wraps @secure_tool)
2. RateLimiter class in src/utils/rate_limiter.py
3. Key function: agent_id + operation + target_id
4. Storage: SlowAPI limiter with memory/redis backend
5. Middleware integration: check limits before Policy Gate

Risk-Based Tiers:
- CRITICAL: 5 req/60s (admin operations)
- HIGH: 10 req/60s (container/network operations)
- MODERATE: 20 req/60s (diagnostics, inventory)
- LOW: 100 req/60s (read-only)

Response on limit exceeded: HTTPException 429 with Retry-After header
Bypass: Environment variable DISABLE_RATE_LIMITING=true (dev only)
acceptance_criteria:
1. slowapi dependency added to pyproject.toml
2. Rate limiter initialized in src/server/dependencies.py
3. All 80 tools categorized by risk level
4. Rate limit decorators applied to all tools
5. Rate limits: 5/10/20/100 req/min by risk level
6. Rate limit exceeded returns 429 with Retry-After header
7. Tests covering rate limit enforcement and bypass scenarios
8. Configuration in environment variables (limits tunable)
9. Monitoring integration (rate limit violations logged)
